intro: Bolandia elongata, commonly known as the slender bolandia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged alternately along its stem. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming a single head that is surrounded by bracts. Bolandia elongata is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to semi-arid conditions.
